meanings.def: a round fruit with shiny red or green skin that is fairly hard and white inside
examples: a garden with three apple trees
I took a bite of the apple.
Add some sugar to the stewed apple—it's still a little tart.
He just sat there munching on an apple.
The apples were all bruised after being dropped on the floor.

meanings.def: a child usually behaves in a similar way to his or her parent(s)
a person or thing that is loved more than any other
examples: She is the apple of her father's eye.

meanings.def: used to describe a situation in which two people or things are completely different from each other
examples: They really are apples and oranges.
They are both great but you can't compare apples and oranges.
It’s a totally different situation, it’s apples and oranges.

meanings.def: used to say that something is typical of America
one bad person who has a bad effect on others in a group

idioms.idiom: the apple doesn’t fall/never falls far from the tree
